title: How can I restrict wifi/cell data access by app?
content: On prior phones that I have owned, Huawei, Samsung, etc. there has always been a simple menu that listed the apps and allowed one to toggle on/off access for wifi and/or cell data.  The only remotely similar function i have found on the pixel is to restrict background data.  The problem is that I need to be able to do this for each app in the foreground.  As an example there are many games with ads that I would like to play while still being able to use cell data for other apps but do not want to waste cell data on ads.  With my prior phones I often blocked access to Youtube to keep videos from playing with browser windows.  Others have recommended Netguard but I discovered this program requires a local VPN to be created but I cannot use that option because I already use a VPN to access my worksite.
